svn-helpers

Source: vignettes/svn-helpers.Rmd
svn-helpers.Rmd

This is a vignette to help you become familiar with using svnLog() and svnExport().

svnLog() provides the history of all edits made to a file, including the author, revision and date/time of the commit. svnExport() makes it easy to restore a file to a previous revision.

Below we will go through examples of both, including cases where the information from svnLog() can be used to more efficiently use svnExport().

Load libraries 

library(review)

svnLog

For the purposes of this vignette, an example SVN repository and file (test-file.txt) were created. Multiple commits were made modifying the file.

To figure out when the modifications were made, we can use svnLog().

svnLog("test-file.txt")
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#>   author   datetime              rev msg          
#>   <chr>    <chr>               <dbl> <chr>        
#> 1 michaelm 2023-09-29 13:54:00     4 fourth commit
#> 2 michaelm 2023-09-29 08:53:00     3 third commit 
#> 3 michaelm 2023-09-28 13:00:30     2 second commit
#> 4 michaelm 2023-09-21 09:10:30     1 first commit

Notice how the output data.frame is sorted such that the most recent commit is shown on the first row. We can see every author and revision number where the file was modified and checked into SVN.

svnExport

Now that we know the revision numbers, we can use svnExport() to view any of the previous revisions. First we can look at what the current version of test-file.txt looks like:

readLines("test-file.txt")
#> [1] "Modified text"

Then, we can use svnExport() to view the first revision of the file.

svnExport(.file = "test-file.txt", .revision = 1)

Notice how this creates a new file, test-file-1.txt in your working directory.

file.exists("test-file-1.txt")
#> [1] TRUE

Now we can take a look at the first revision of the file.

readLines("test-file-1.txt")
#> [1] "Initial text"

This process can be done for any file that has been checked into your SVN repository. svnLog() can easily identify the revision numbers of past edits and svnExport() can restore the file with a file name following this syntax [{original file name}-{revision number}].
